name: Sinovia Technologies
headline: Flexible printed OLED displays.
description: We use the printing methods used for newspapers, packaging, posters, and other graphic media to make beautiful, emissive electronic displays with high-end OLED technology aimed at low-cost applications. Our displays are paper-thin, flexible, and can be easily custom printed in a variety of shapes and sizes, allowing hardware designers to use displays and indicators on curved surfaces and in new ways.
generated_description:
Sinovia Technologies, founded in 2010 and part of the Y Combinator Batch W17, is on a mission to change how we think about displays. Based in San Carlos, CA, this hard-tech company of just seven employees specializes in manufacturing flexible printed OLED displays, using methods typically reserved for traditional printing processes like newspapers and posters. Their approach allows them to create stunning, emissive displays that are not only thin and flexible but also customized to a variety of shapes and sizes.

Imagine displays that can wrap around a curved surface or fit seamlessly into your gadget—it’s this innovative capability that sets Sinovia apart. They've tapped into high-quality, low-cost OLED technology aimed at low-cost applications, perfect for use in everything from consumer electronics to medical devices.

At the core of their design ethos is the Printed Light Film, delivering low-power, bright illumination for any surface. This unique product paves the way for novel applications in various industries, including IoT and smart hardware, evidenced by their tags of “hard-tech,” “hardware,” and “iot.” 

If you’re interested in exploring what Sinovia Technologies can do, or if you're looking to collaborate, their website [Sinovia Tech](http://www.sinoviatech.com) offers a straightforward path to contact them. With foundational support from resources like the National Science Foundation and the Department of Energy, they are well-positioned to carve out new frontiers in the display technology landscape.

In a nutshell, Sinovia Technologies isn’t just developing displays; they’re redefining how we interact with technology on a fundamental level. Their vision of integrating beautiful, functional displays into more of our daily devices promises to shape the future of both aesthetics and functionality in tech.
